creator: ppan@macrosoftchina.com
text:
Hi,

  If URL include "xxx@xxx.com", the browser can't open the URL.
  Such as: 
  http://www.apache.org/xxx@xxxx.com/
  http://drupal.org/xxx@xxx.com/ 
  http://www.apple.com/xxx@xxx.com/
  etc.
  Is it apache server bug ?

Peter

creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
Works perfectly fine for me when "xxx@xxx.com" is a directory in the document root. If you think otherwise, I suggest discussing it on the users mailing list along with the config, logs, request, response, and what you expect the browser and server to do and why.


http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html

(In reply to comment #1)
> Works perfectly fine for me when "xxx@xxx.com" is a directory in the document
> root. If you think otherwise, I suggest discussing it on the users mailing list
> along with the config, logs, request, response, and what you expect the browser
> and server to do and why.
> 
> 
> http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html

Thanks,

  But, if my url is : http://hostname/appname?mail=xxx@xxx.com .My  browser can't open the URL . And other url is working , such as : http://hostname/appname?mail=petermail20051@gmail.com . 

  My response :
  IE: Internet Explorer cannot display the webpage
  Apple Safari : 
Safari can’t open the page.
Safari can’t open the page “http://www.apache.org/app?mail=xxx@xxx.com”. The error is: “unknown error” (kCFErrorDomainWinSock:10054) Please choose Help > Report Bugs to Apple, note the error number, and describe what you did before you saw this message.

peter
creator: ppan@macrosoftchina.com

text: This is a bug database, not a support forum.  If you have questions about how the web server works, follow the previous suggestion on where to ask for help.
creator: poirier@pobox.com
ppan@macrosoftchina.com
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> This is a bug database, not a support forum.  If you have questions about how
> the web server works, follow the previous suggestion on where to ask for help.

thanks!
